comments:
I have the same problem as for the bug '94010', but for a bean inside a 
package. Sometimes the problem doesn't occur, sometimes it does !!!
When I have the problem, the wizard proposes a different Dynamic Web project 
than the project the bean belongs to, in the fields 'Service project' 
and 'Service module'.

I am using version 1.0M8.
The stack trace is :
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl.getResource
(ResourceSetImpl.java:316)
    at 
org.eclipse.jem.internal.util.emf.workbench.ProjectResourceSetImpl.getResource
(ProjectResourceSetImpl.java:262)
    at 
org.eclipse.jem.internal.util.emf.workbench.ProjectResourceSetImpl.getEObject
(ProjectResourceSetImpl.java:185)
    at org.eclipse.jem.java.impl.JavaRefFactoryImpl.reflectType
(JavaRefFactoryImpl.java:359)
    at org.eclipse.jem.java.impl.JavaRefFactoryImpl.reflectType
(JavaRefFactoryImpl.java:345)
    at org.eclipse.jem.java.impl.JavaClassImpl.reflect(JavaClassImpl.java:1069)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.creation.ui.command.JavaToWSDLMethodCommand.ex
ecute(JavaToWSDLMethodCommand.java:94)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.runCom
mand(CommandFragmentEngine.java:335)

Michel,
the dynamic Web project proposed by the wizard is computed from the project 
containing the successfully reflected Java class, so the behaviour of getting 
the wrong project/module is at least explained as a consequence of the NPE 
during reflection of your service class. This doesn't explain why the NPE in 
Java reflection is happening in the first place. This could be a timing issue 
(Java compilation isn't quite finished when we try to reflect the class) or a 
bug in JEM. Needless to say, intermittent bugs are difficult to diagnose.

Can you think of any differences, no matter how insignificant, in the 
configuration of your workspace, "freshness" of Eclipse WTP, etc. that might be 
linked to the successful vs. unsuccessful uses of the wizard?

Can you zip up and attach your Dynamic Web project, including your Java class, 
to this bug?

Created an attachment (id=29441)
Here is a zip file of the project

As requested by cbrealey@ca.ibm.com.
The project is a very simple one. Its purpose is to test WS environment.
I just intalled a completely new eclipse with : SDK 3.1, emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.1.0,
GEF-ALL-3.1, VE-runtime-1.1.0.1, wtp-1.0M8.
So, the JEM package is comming from the Visual Editor and has the 1.1.0.1
version

When the problem appears, it will happen every time inside the same eclipse
session. I should exit from eclipse and reenter to eventually correct the
problem.

I just installed a new eclipse framework with : SDK 3.1, emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-
2.1.0, GEF-ALL-3.1, VE-runtime-1.1.0.1, wtp-1.0M8.
So the JEM package is coming from the Visual Editor with a version 1.1.0.1.

When the problem appears it will always happen inside the same eclipse 
session : I should exit from eclipse.
When I enter back eclipse the problem may disappear !!!
Please re-open if you are able to reproduce this problem with WTP 2.0 or recent WTP 2.0.1 driver.
Closing old un-verified defects.  Please re-open if this is still a problem.
